item.title: 5 Security Concerns When Using Static Site Generators
item.description: Static == Secure Right? If you’ve read my recent post extolling the virtues of static site generators for secure web development you might think that deploying a static site makes you more or less invulnerable to cyber adversaries. Although it’s true that going static dramatically reduces your vulnerability profile, it doesn’t quite eliminate it. This post considers five possible attack vectors against websites built with static generators (e.g. Jekyl, Hugo, etc.

item.title: Static Sites: The Ideal Security Blogging Platform
item.description: Juggling Priorities It should come as no surprise that, when building this site, my first concern was security. This arose partially from the fact that I live and breathe cybersecurity and believe (not without cause) that the whole internet is out to get me. However, it’s also true that sites focused on cyber issues tend to present attractive targets to hackers attempting to prove their skills and gain some renown with people who might actually appreciate their accomplishments.

item.title: pavursec.org
item.description: pavursec.org In addition to serving as the standard bootstrap-heavy web portfolio. This site provides a location for me to consolidate my thoughts, projects, and web persona as well as an opportunity to experiment with new technologies. As I work on new projects they’ll be added to this site - wherever they may be hosted. It also hosts my blog where I’ll share my thoughts on cyberpolicy, security research discoveries and disclosures, and general technical musings.
